page.title: 18CARNOCK
page.content: Carnock probably got its name from Caer- a fort and Knock - a hill and dates from Pre- Roman times. The old ruined church dates back to the eleventh century and has a Pre- Christain Pictish stone set in one wall. The oldest gravestone is dated 1623 . There used to be a grain mill which is abandoned in 1885 when it became uneconomic. People who lived in Carnock about fifty years ago were mainly farm workers or miners who worked at Bogside mine.Nowadays most resideuts travel to work elsewhere. At one time Carnock had about twenty three hostelries but now it has only one. It is the Old Inn and is dated around 1700.Nowadays five to six hundred people live in Carnock- some in new houses recently built.
